commit_message:
cpu-model-selection: s/cpu_models/cpu_model_list/

For clarity and sanity, propose `cpu_model_list` instead of the plural
variant, `cpu_models`, of the pre-existing `cpu_model`.  Otherwise,
supporting both the singular and plural variants (`cpu_model`,
`cpu_models`) at the _same_ time is hard to distinguish and can result
in easy screw-ups.  Avoid it.

While at it, touch up a couple of ultra minor things: use correct
capitalization for acroynyms like CPU, QEMU; use the rST inline literals
consistently; and a grammar fix.

blueprint: cpu-model-selection

Change-Id: Ib62e5e67d0af2a39b57812c73a10fb29e71408c5
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I1212ccc59dfb5d06f607d9f1f75a409bb8ef5500
'}, {'created': '2019-03-07 16:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Release python-novaclient 13.0.0

This is a major version bump because of the 2.68 change:

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-novaclient/unreleased.html#upgrade-notes

"Added support for microversion 2.68, which removes the --force option
from the nova evacuate, nova live-migration, nova host-evacuate and nova
host-evacuate-live commands."

Since the nova CLI negotiates the max microversion to use between the
client and server, if this is running against a Stein nova-api it will
remove the --force option from those commands, so someone whose script
is not pinned to a particular microversion and is using the
--force option would break. Granted, they can simply pass
--os-compute-api-version=2.67 to work around that, and probably should
have been pinning the requested version in scripts anyway to avoid
backward incompatible API changes on the CLI, i.e. the CLI behavior is
akin to passing microversion 2.latest which you shouldn't really do if
you're going for stability, and we have said in the past that the nova
CLI is not a bash SDK. So the major bump is possibly unnecessary, but
safe.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1212ccc59dfb5d06f607d9f1f75a409bb8ef5500
'}]
commit_message:
Release python-novaclient 13.0.0

This is a major version bump because of the 2.68 change:

https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/python-novaclient/unreleased.html#upgrade-notes

"Added support for microversion 2.68, which removes the --force option
from the nova evacuate, nova live-migration, nova host-evacuate and nova
host-evacuate-live commands."

Since the nova CLI negotiates the max microversion to use between the
client and server, if this is running against a Stein nova-api it will
remove the --force option from those commands, so someone whose script
is not pinned to a particular microversion and is using the
--force option would break. Granted, they can simply pass
--os-compute-api-version=2.67 to work around that, and probably should
have been pinning the requested version in scripts anyway to avoid
backward incompatible API changes on the CLI, i.e. the CLI behavior is
akin to passing microversion 2.latest which you shouldn't really do if
you're going for stability, and we have said in the past that the nova
CLI is not a bash SDK. So the major bump is possibly unnecessary, but
safe.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I1212ccc59dfb5d06f607d9f1f75a409bb8ef5500

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I441719fc44f5ad9ef4b9dbc28a7413f04b0feb97
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Updates Octavia to support octavia-lib

This is the base patch that updates octavia to use the new octavia-lib.
It is backwards compatible by using debtcollector moves.

It adds a new controller process called the "driver-agent".

This patch also adds unit test coverage for a few additional modules.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641180/

Change-Id: I438e1548ec0fb6111d1ab85b05015007d9d0a006

commit_message:
Add bionic nodeset for legacy job to switch to bionic

We have migrated all the zuulv3 native jobs to Bionic[1]
and now time to make legacy job also start running on Bionic
node.

This commit adds the bionic nodeset (single as well as multinode) for
legacy job so that each project can start their testing.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2018-December/000837.html

Change-Id: Ie79b20b7fc5cec63be26d2ac8231f6822e61e089

commit_message:
Add user_id column to the instance_mappings table

The instance_mappings table already contains the project_id for an
instance. This adds the corresponding user_id. This also adds an index
on (user_id, project_id) because later patches in this series will be
using these columns for quota counting.

Part of blueprint count-quota-usage-from-placement

Change-Id: Id9eef7a58f66c73cd638c6c3e228447b7ab81e34

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 06:28:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9c9c67c53e3a1312c41c41974c3d04b8cff75890
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9c9c67c53e3a1312c41c41974c3d04b8cff75890

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: Ib292676471279086f8b4e1e5b8f6638865eb4350

This change seems fine, including not changing the job parent because we don't want behavior unintentionally being modified by tying unrelated jobs together. Before we approve it, I think it would be good to give all of the teams a heads-up with a mailing list post, because it's going to go into effect immediately and if it does happen to break it's going to break a *lot* of teams."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-12-17 03:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-17 13:38:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-17 18:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing vmware-nsx with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625684/'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-17 20:24:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Voting -1 to signify that we have a failure from this change in the vmware-nsx project [1].


The latest lower-constraints failure shows [2]:

  Error: could not determine PostgreSQL version from '10.6'


However at the moment I'm unsure as to what's causing this.
Any help is appreciated.


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625684/
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/84/625684/1/check/vmware-tox-lower-constraints/3b21419/tox/lower-constraints-1.log"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-18 11:08:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Voting -1 to signify that we have a failure from this change in the
 > vmware-nsx project [1].

Thanks. 

 > Error: could not determine PostgreSQL version from '10.6'

That's effectively a real failure in the lower-constraints job. The new node has postgresql 10 on it, and the version of pyscopg2 is too old to support that. You'll want a new version: psycopg2==2.7"}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-18 14:18:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Submitted a patch to test neutron as well: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625922/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-18 18:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

boden, are you ready to remove your -1 based on the testing and feedback here?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-18 18:41:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Andreas: I was planning to leave my -1 vote until we can land [1]. Without [1] the vmware-nsx lower-constraints job will break with python 3.6 as herein.


[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/625684/'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-18 20:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

manila lower-constraints job runs fine with null change depending on this patch: http://logs.openstack.org/03/625603/1/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/942f30d/'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-12-19 17:54:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So think we got things vmware-nsx/master working, but am now having some issues with stable branches..


In regards to pyscopg2>=2.7 as we discussed earlier; this works for master. However it doesn't work for stable/queens because of global requirement caps. See [1]. That said it's unclear to me how to resolve the issue with stable branches.


[1] http://logs.openstack.org/20/625520/8/check/requirements-check/ca21b5b/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-12-19_16_59_59_337330"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-12-19 18:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I agree that this change likely should be made only for master and not for existing stable branches.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-12-19 19:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

I missed noticing that openstack-zuul-jobs is not branched and that this change would hit stable/* branches in the other projects.  My remarks earlier about testing with manila were on master.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-19 19:26:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-20 07:41:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

How would people prefer the branch handling be done? I'm not clear on all the options, but two of them seem to be:

* create a new python 3.5 lower constraints job and have it run on stable/rocky and before and have the existing job run on master and stable/stein and beyond
* do the reverse of that: make the existing job only run on old branches and create a newly named one to do 3.6

Which of those is best? If neither, what are the alternatives?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-20 08:28:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

If all projects would use the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs, we could easily introduce a new job and update the project-template to use it.

And have both jobs constrainted to certain branches.

But right now only 90 repos use the template while 180 repos use the jobs directly.

so, shall we ask projects to update the 180 repos to use the template where possible (and otherwise the new job)?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-12-20 13:34:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> If all projects would use the openstack-lower-constraints-jobs, we
 > could easily introduce a new job and update the project-template to
 > use it.
 > 
 > And have both jobs constrainted to certain branches.
 > 
 > But right now only 90 repos use the template while 180 repos use
 > the jobs directly.
 > 
 > so, shall we ask projects to update the 180 repos to use the
 > template where possible (and otherwise the new job)?

I think we need to start training teams to use project templates where they are available so we can avoid problems like this in the future.

So, it sounds like we need to add a new job, add the new job to the project template with the appropriate branch specifiers on both jobs there, then update projects that are using the old job name directly to use the template.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-20 19:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Chris, I'm pushing some changes to use the template - I use the same topic as this change."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-20 20:16:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Oh, I think it's only 90 repos to change...."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-12-20 20:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've now updated all repos that could use the template. Not updated are repos that inherit the job or add extra requirements... I leave those to others."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-12-21 10:30:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I've now updated all repos that could use the template. Not updated
 > are repos that inherit the job or add extra requirements... I leave
 > those to others.

Thanks very much for doing that.

I probably won't be able to get to the other changes until early January, so if someone else has time between now and then, please feel free. Otherwise I'll pick it up then."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-08 08:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Not needed anymore with change
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/641895/'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-03-08 08:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Chris, want to abandon and go with the other change?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-08 09:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Hurrah. changing everything much better.'}]

commit_message:
Make lower-constraints job use python 3.6

This change is being done for two reasons:

1) We'd like to make all the python3 jobs use python 3.6
2) The job in the Needed-By below fails in python 3.5
   because of different behaviors with package resource
   entry-points leading to entry points not being found
   in tests.

The bindep profile and nodeset are update to choose python 3.6.

Another way to have achieved this would have been to make the
parent of lower-constraints be openstack-tox-py36. It's not clear
which is the best choice.

Change-Id: I082160a29b51bd578d159a13cea4d511c1228e3e
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/622972

commit_message:
css: Use ellipsis for long titles in sidebar

This replaces I4808aa43a93b8bd28c85e8feccbaea6bf821c8e5 by keeping text
on one line but simply slicing off the stuff that's too long. You can
probably infer most of the context from this snippet. The added margin
is necessary to make it look not ugly.

Change-Id: I23bc2f4414b69c1ee4b9552f554423e457571554
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

css: Don't use bold text in titles

It looks like we're shouting. Monospace is more than adequate.

commit_message:
Disable limits if force_hosts or force_nodes is set

Setting max_placement_results will make force_host invaild sometimes,
especially in large-scale enviroment.
Disable limit param in GET /allocation_candidates if force_hosts
or force_nodes is set.

NOTE(xulei): There are differences from the original change because
I496e8d64907fdcb0e2da255725aed1fc529725f2 was not in stable/queens,
so we transplant code to get_allocation_candidates in this backport.

Change-Id: Iff1b49fe7e6347e3c2bb5992494b2450809719a2
Closes-Bug: #1777591
(cherry picked from commit 1d91811ad499af1d291f5c819ced5b1fdf3520c7)

[{'created': '2019-03-07 17:47:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatched mod_uwsgi for python3

On python3 we dont want the mod_uwsgi that is compliled for python2
Add inclusion and exclusion of the proper version to bindep.txt

Change-Id: I7e780487fa5539ad473676837981c8a8debc0ba2
'}, {'created': '2019-03-07 19:31:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatched mod_wsgi for python3

Under opensuse, there are two packages for mod_wsgi depending on
python version, and we select only a version compiled for python2.

This is a problem, as running python3 with mod_wsgi will segfault.

This fixes it by installing the right version depending on the python
profile.

Change-Id: I7e780487fa5539ad473676837981c8a8debc0ba2
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatched mod_wsgi for python3

Under opensuse, there are two packages for mod_wsgi depending on
python version, and we select only a version compiled for python2.

This is a problem, as running python3 with mod_wsgi will segfault.

This fixes it by installing the right version depending on the python
profile.

Change-Id: I7e780487fa5539ad473676837981c8a8debc0ba2

Change-Id: I3cb85be854e68fda525cfebe254ce7c85d8e3d37

commit_message:
Revert "Remove truncate from rootwrap filters"

This reverts commit a62c9dfdd41ab0be8bedd99ca39b82701d73ef4f.

This did not account for cases where truncate is
called w/o elevated privileges.

Related-Bug: #1818504
Change-Id: I3cb85be854e68fda525cfebe254ce7c85d8e3d37

Use template for lower-constraints

Small cleanups:

* Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template, remove individual
  jobs.
* Sort list of templates

commit_message:
Add try except in the decorator to let the image form display the error we want

When creating a image, select an empty file and the error message is incorrect.

Change-Id: I087aa91b0740415328f124240bacd8c4e80ba07b
Closes-Bug: #1819083

commit_message:
introspection data backend: migration tool

This patch provides a simple tool to help with migrating introspection
data between two introspection data storages.

Story: 1726713
Task: 11373

Change-Id: I2a930dbad2178e3dde6725e2620d8099e4e21d78

commit_message:
Display progress_details of the notification

Added 1.1 microversion support which will display `progress_details`
of the notification.

Note: Referred APIVersion class from python-novaclient [1].

[1]: https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/api_versions.py#L42

Depends-On: I93c1b7d88823e02d9a02855cabb8b22c9e40a7d5
Implements: bp progress-details-recovery-workflows
Change-Id: I9ba787bc8ef9528a7cff5b4c1411dffa454b66d2

commit_message:
Set worker model to be the default

We will create new grenade gate that ensure upgrading
procedures from pool-manager-->worker and pool-manager-->pool-manager
by setting $DESIGNATE_ENABLED_WORKER_MODEL variable.

Co-Authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5e220738a18422a28a3384db1ab671ea111ac9b2
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Remove Ubuntu Xenial from metadata.json

This is not supported anymore since packaging
for Stein will not only be for Bionic.

Change-Id: I1cd3f51d32228b41f6ec0f4ac9ac340c3efcdec4

commit_message:
Add sample templates for Blazar

Since Rocky, Heat supports Blazar which is a reservation service in
OpenStack. This patch provides sample templates regarding Blazar Host
and Lease resources accordingly.

Change-Id: I169a96c63eee59ec9b0d098f86709e6d02d1209f
Depends-On: I1392919540a6bdd67ce7078e3a1206ecdb9854e1

commit_message:
Add progress details for recovery workflows

This patch uses taskflow's persistence feature to store recovery
workflows details into database.

Added a new microversion to return progress_details of the
notification in `GET /notifications/<notification_uuid>` API.

APIImpact:
GET /notifications/<notification_uuid> API includes details
of recovery workflow

Change-Id: I93c1b7d88823e02d9a02855cabb8b22c9e40a7d5
Implements: bp progress-details-recovery-workflows

[{'created': '2019-02-25 15:41:43.000000000', 'message': "hook: avoid restart of nova-compute after SRIOV configuration

It's not necessary to trigger a restart of Nova compute service after
to have configured virtual functions on host. Nova is running a
periodic task to collect resources on host. The process of collecting
is refering to libvirt to get details of PCI devices, where libvirt
got automatically notified by UDEV events whether a change occurs.

Also that we may be in a situation where we ask for a restart however
the pci/pci_passthough_whitlist config from nova.conf has not yet been
updated.

Change-Id: Ib373150290e12a4c48edbfeef8bfabd5677bb8ac

commit_message:
hooks: avoid restart of nova-compute after SRIOV configuration

It's not necessary to trigger a restart of Nova compute service after
to have configured virtual functions on host. Nova is running a
periodic task to collect resources on host. The process of collecting
is refering to libvirt to get details of PCI devices, where libvirt
got automatically notified by UDEV events whether a change occurs.

Also that we may be in a situation where we ask for a restart however
the pci/pci_passthough_whitlist config from nova.conf has not yet been
updated.

Change-Id: Ib373150290e12a4c48edbfeef8bfabd5677bb8ac
Related-to: #1817085
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Add cache-manage utility using v2 API

In Rocky, the v1 dependent glance-cache-manage command was removed while
removing Images API v1 entry points.

As a part of edge-computing image caching will play a big role. To
provide support of image caching, added cache-manage utility using
V2 API. This utility will have the same interface as Queens
glance-cache-manage utility [0] as far as possible.

[0] https://docs.openstack.org/glance/queens/cli/glancecachemanage.html

In addition to above command line options added below new options for doamin
information to use in v3 authentication:
--os-domain-id
--os-user-domain-id
--os-project-domain-id

Implements: blueprint cache-manage
Change-Id: I127c84f8ea610cc20eb3ac2f4f6a9a47a7233f5f

commit_message:
Improve Intel FPGA driver

Generate oslo_versioned objects when discovering intel fpga device.
Add unit tests.

Change-Id: I0af5b3da86d579c8a322d723a34dca977d7fe210

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-06 15:30:10.000000000', 'message': "Adds User Message in case of Shrinking Error

When shrinking of a share fails, there is no User Message generated.
This change uses the Message API module and updates the user message
list suggesting an UNEXPECTED_NETWORK error, which corresponds to:

UNEXPECTED_NETWORK = ('003', 'Driver does not expect share-network
	to be provided with current configuration.')

Change-Id: Ifcc616a0e90e720e5ec5b02fb8c7dfa049e1c20b
Closes-Bug: #1802424

Deletes temporary files

This change deletes the temp files that were added during the last
commit.

Change-Id: I04e0224706852b1ae435b12a8861bb0683a4d3ca
Closes-Bug: #1802424
"}]
commit_message:
Adds User Message in case of Shrinking Error

When shrinking of a share fails, there is no User Message generated.
This change uses the Message API module and updates the user message
list suggesting an UNEXPECTED_NETWORK error, which corresponds to:

UNEXPECTED_NETWORK = ('003', 'Driver does not expect share-network
	to be provided with current configuration.')

Change-Id: Ifcc616a0e90e720e5ec5b02fb8c7dfa049e1c20b
Closes-Bug: #1802424

Deletes temporary files

This change deletes the temp files that were added during the last
commit.

Change-Id: I04e0224706852b1ae435b12a8861bb0683a4d3ca
Closes-Bug: #1802424

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-08 00:24:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use ubuntu-xenial explicitly in py35 jobs

In preparation for switching the base job to ubuntu-bionic which has
Python 3.6 by default and no Python 3.5, be explicit about the
nodeset for py35 jobs so they will continue to work. Also configure
the lower-constraints job to include the py36 bindep profile in
preparation for when it switches nodesets.

Change-Id: I560fb0ab43dd85bb03f13eff8bb0358f768c0e9b
'}]
commit_message:
Use ubuntu-xenial explicitly in py35 jobs

In preparation for switching the base job to ubuntu-bionic which has
Python 3.6 by default and no Python 3.5, be explicit about the
nodeset for py35 jobs so they will continue to work. Also configure
the lower-constraints job to include the py36 bindep profile in
preparation for when it switches nodesets.

Change-Id: I560fb0ab43dd85bb03f13eff8bb0358f768c0e9b

commit_message:
Run atop in light mode in upstream

Makes the final log size much smaller and lowers the strain on
logserver.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639669
Change-Id: I382774b1c89746a9dd8154e3cc2e0db0db67b50a
Partial-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1818980

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2019-03-08 04:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-07 10:32:45.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic5ef9f6d2924c0c8b7405eba1d78c9b68b765abc
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic5ef9f6d2924c0c8b7405eba1d78c9b68b765abc

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I0f24a345b0d805428b2847d559e84208a3610d4f
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix --centos-mirror default

This option has been deprecated in commit [1] but still needs to
keep backwards compatibility with a default mirror for centos.

[1] 98a91a87df6b8294a0133809e69830103ec2bd73

Change-Id: Id3fa45175b9d98d4bdb5fd178ab6d037807edfa1
Closes-Bug: #1818677

commit_message:
overcloud plan deployment status

Add a new command to tripleoclient:
openstack overcloud plan deployment status

The command shows the top level deployment status based on a plan name
and makes use of the
tripleo.plan_management.v1.get_plan_deployment_status workflow.

Change-Id: I600fe9b83b69aee64d8ca44e405d0c5e7a20a273
Depends-On: Ia8e3ecadfb97c0827c396cd418c32d3daa2e299b
(cherry picked from commit 0220592660bb7e0f607f9554c8a906a883209247)

commit_message:
Adds retag with version hash for periodic container builds

For the periodic jobs once we build containers and push to rdo
registry we also need to tag the images with the delorean repo
hash

This switches the current tagging so we instead tag during build
using the version-hash and then tag with tripleo-ci-testing
when its periodic

Testing at https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/19131/

Change-Id: I727e748eee641e12cede74773497dce49fcb317c

commit_message:
Support cinder-volume running active-active

Add the ability to run the cinder-volume service in an active-active
configuration via a new CinderVolumeCluster parameter. The cinder-volume
service runs A/A only when configured with a cluster name.

Change-Id: Ic76742d3835d93bf16f5d9c13a2786fd7a373423
Depends-On: I615af64086d46356f322094d9f3b4e29557ed899

subject: hooks: fix initial sriov configurations
messages:
[{'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-25 15:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-26 14:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2019-02-27 08:51:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I find this change dangerous. configure_sriov will set sriov_numvfs to 0, then N on every config-changed or neutron-plugin-relation-changed hook. This means that instances using VFs will lose connectivity in case any change is done via Juju.
https://github.com/openstack/charm-neutron-openvswitch/blob/bd1cc362f139f4854872a7eb87a62c4fc8273dbf/hooks/neutron_ovs_hooks.py#L99:L124

Number of VFs should only be changed when an interface goes from "down" operstate to "up" (after a reboot, or manual ip link set). Alternatively, an action could be run to force the setting.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2019-02-28 09:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 24890, 'date': '2019-02-28 14:29:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-25 15:00:30.000000000', 'message': "hooks: fix initial SRIOV configurations

To configure SRIOV functions it was expected that the 'sriov-numvfs'
config option to be changed but during an initial setup this not
happen. To fix the issue we compare whether the option has been
updated which should handle the case of a initial setup as well as the
case where the config really changed and the last one which is when we
pass to that process but the config did not changed.

Change-Id: Ib8232b29f76ca7e25e1cd835d5e31a276000f1d4
Closes-Bug: #1817079
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-02-26 14:27:06.000000000', 'message': "hooks: fix initial sriov configurations

To configure SRIOV devices it was expected that the 'sriov-numvfs'
config option to be changed but during an initial setup this not
happens. Since even the default value is required that the process to
configure devices there are no ways to avoid passing via this function
even if already done.

Change-Id: Ib8232b29f76ca7e25e1cd835d5e31a276000f1d4
Closes-Bug: #1817079
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-02-28 09:33:17.000000000', 'message': "hooks: fix initial sriov configurations

To configure SRIOV devices it was expected that the 'sriov-numvfs'
config option to be changed but during an initial setup this not
happens.

In this commit we remove the condition but add a logic in
PCINetDevice to avoid reconfiguring PF devices if not necessary.

Change-Id: Ib8232b29f76ca7e25e1cd835d5e31a276000f1d4
Closes-Bug: #1817079
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-03-07 11:54:37.000000000', 'message': "hooks: fix initial sriov configurations

To configure SRIOV devices it was expected that the 'sriov-numvfs'
config option to be changed but during an initial setup this not
happens.

In this commit we remove the condition but add a logic in
PCINetDevice to avoid reconfiguring PF devices if not necessary.

Change-Id: Ib8232b29f76ca7e25e1cd835d5e31a276000f1d4
Closes-Bug: #1817079
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
hooks: fix initial sriov configurations

To configure SRIOV devices it was expected that the 'sriov-numvfs'
config option to be changed but during an initial setup this not
happens.

In this commit we remove the condition but add a logic in
PCINetDevice to avoid reconfiguring PF devices if not necessary.

Change-Id: Ib8232b29f76ca7e25e1cd835d5e31a276000f1d4
Closes-Bug: #1817079
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@canonical.com>

According to the work items cited in merged spec [1], the current design is to have this support directly in OSC repo.
Based on the developer guide [2], "network segment range" is something "Doesn’t Exist" in neither neutron Command nor openstack Command. So the CLI change should be openstack. Besides it is also L2/L3 related.
I am personally open to the place where/the way how this should be included.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/599980/6/specs/stein/network-segment-range-management.rst@542
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/python-neutronclient/latest/contributor/transition_to_osc.html'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-12-30 13:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-02 09:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(12 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-02 11:29:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-26 07:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-26 09:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-01-26 16:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-02-04 16:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(7 comments)

This looks pretty good overall Kailun.

One other thing I would like to think about is what errors we return when the network segment range extension is not present in Neutron.  Right now it is a 404 that indicates the resource could not be found.  The resource name is in the URL that is shown but we could be more explicit there.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-05 02:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-05 02:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(9 comments)

Thanks a lot for the comments. Add explicit command errors when the network segment range extension is not present in Neutron.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-05 02:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-14 10:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-14 17:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-02-27 19:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-27 23:39:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> (3 comments)

Dean, thanks for the comments. I found there are actually few set cmds do produce outputs [1][2]. I'm not familiar w/ those cmds though. Just want to make sure - OSC set cmds produce no outputs, is this a rule/common practice, any specific reason for this? Thanks a lot. 

@Dean, @Yulong and other reviewers,
what's your suggestions?

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/identity/v3/limit.py#L204
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/identity/v3/registered_limit.py#L196"}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-28 01:38:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-02-28 01:38:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:40:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> > (3 comments)
 > 
 > Dean, thanks for the comments. I found there are actually few set
 > cmds do produce outputs [1][2]. I'm not familiar w/ those cmds
 > though. Just want to make sure - OSC set cmds produce no outputs,
 > is this a rule/common practice, any specific reason for this?
 > Thanks a lot.
 > 
 > @Dean, @Yulong and other reviewers,
 > what's your suggestions?
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/identity/v3/limit.py#L204
 > [2] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/master/openstackclient/identity/v3/registered_limit.py#L196

I'm not quite sure if there is a consensus that the set command should or should not have output. But for this 'set range' command here, I would like to see the result without extra commands. And since we are trying to update the resource attributes without involving any other resources. It is something like that we update it and show itself.
IIRC there are some set commands which will create the relationship to other resources. For these commands, the OSC client does not have outputs. Because sometimes all the resources, involved to the set command, may have changes. OSC does not have to print all the changes. And it is a bit difficult for the command to decide how and which should be set to the output."}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:40:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-02-28 15:44:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

There may be some set commands that have output, they slipped through after we explicitly changed those that did to have no output a few years ago.

The idea is simply the UNIX philosophy of "if there are no problems there is nothing to report".  We show output on create commands because there is new information, set commands to not produce new information, if they do arguably it should not be a set command but a create command.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-03-01 07:59:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Thanks both Dean and Yulong for your comments. Personally, I'm in favor of Yulong's suggestion - to have the updated network segment range information printed out, as it shows the available and usage statistics of the updated range as well (not only the operation success/fail). It looks more user-friendly to me.
I fully understand Dean's idea of the UNIX philosophy which aligns with the other OSC set cmds and also makes sense to me.
So I add more Neutron core reviewers here to see if any further inputs/comments.
Thank you all. :)"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2019-03-04 17:38:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> Thanks both Dean and Yulong for your comments. Personally, I'm in
 > favor of Yulong's suggestion - to have the updated network segment
 > range information printed out, as it shows the available and usage
 > statistics of the updated range as well (not only the operation
 > success/fail). It looks more user-friendly to me.
 > I fully understand Dean's idea of the UNIX philosophy which aligns
 > with the other OSC set cmds and also makes sense to me.
 > So I add more Neutron core reviewers here to see if any further
 > inputs/comments.
 > Thank you all. :)

My inclination is to agree with Dean.  Especially with how these kinds of commands get used in scripting and automation, consistency in output format is key."}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-05 14:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

OSC set commands do not have output unless there is an exception or error.  This is ready to merge once that output is removed from the set command.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-03-05 15:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-03-05 15:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks all for your comments!
Based on the current feedbacks, let's align the "network segment range set" command w/ the other OSC set commands - do not have output unless there is an exception or error, so that consistency can be kept in output format which helps w/ the scripting and automation.
We can still reopen the discussion in the future if needed.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-05 23:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+2

Thank you Kailun'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-06 17:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-07 19:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-07 19:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I removed the depends-on lines as those three reviews are all +W in Neutron and working through the date.  OSC freeze deadline approaches we have to do what will become the stable release now so merge this anyway.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-03-07 22:41:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

recheck - osc-functional-devstack failed in gate and I'm not waiting on the rest to finish since it's a total restart anyway and was clean earlier... failure is aggregate functional test"}, {'account_id': 28373, 'date': '2019-03-08 00:13:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Add network segment range command object

Add network segment range command object in support of network segment
range management.

This patch set includes documentation, unit tests and functional tests
(currently skipped unit network segment range enabled in Neutron by
default) for the following new commands:
  - "os network segment range create"
  - "os network segment range delete"
  - "os network segment range list"
  - "os network segment range set"
  - "os network segment range show"

Co-authored-by: Allain Legacy <Allain.legacy@windriver.com>

[depends on removed by dtroyer as those are all +W and 
trying to pass the gate, OSC has it's freeze dealine looming]
 Depends: https://review.openstack.org/624708
 Depends: https://review.openstack.org/624709
 Depends: https://review.openstack.org/638386

Partially-implements: blueprint network-segment-range-management
Change-Id: I335692f2db5be07c1c164f09b13f1abb80b7ba33

commit_message:
Add podsecuritypolicy test

This adds a test for the podsecuritypolicy chart, as well as a script
to reconfigure minikube with PodSecurityPolity enabled when appropriate.

This change doesn't add the PSP chart to the existing tests, because
the psp chart will have secure defaults in the future, which may
interfere with other charts by default; and it doesn't enable the
admission controller broadly, because turning the AC on without
providing a podsecuritypolicy will break k8s functionality.

Change-Id: I9fd14bb118189cd4ead177b79e39aadbc2096b4a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-16 19:15:38.000000000', 'message': "Ensure http proxy environment is available during 'atomic install' for k8s

The scripts run by cloud-init for the master and minion nodes currently
write proxy environment variables into /bin/bashrc when they are defined.

These variables will only be introduced into the running environment
when a new bash shell is started. The /bin/sh used by the fragment
scripts will ignore /etc/bashrc, so the new shells invoked per fragment
will not have the http proxy variables present. This means that the
master/minion node deployment fails when behind an http proxy.

This patch adds explicit exports for HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY when those
variables are defined, and not empty.

Change-Id: Id05c90d5bf99d720ae6002b38d3291e364e1e0c4

commit_message:
Ensure http proxy environment is available during 'atomic install' for k8s

The scripts run by cloud-init for the master and minion nodes currently
write proxy environment variables into /bin/bashrc when they are defined.

These variables will only be introduced into the running environment
when a new bash shell is started. The /bin/sh used by the fragment
scripts will ignore /etc/bashrc, so the new shells invoked per fragment
will not have the http proxy variables present. This means that the
master/minion node deployment fails when behind an http proxy.

This patch adds explicit exports for HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY when those
variables are defined, and not empty.

Task: 29863
Change-Id: Id05c90d5bf99d720ae6002b38d3291e364e1e0c4

commit_message:
Pass python3 flag to bindep

pydep is passing python3 flag correctly, but bindep isn't.

Instead bindep only received a "yes" or "no", based on the arguments
given, to its profile.

Change-Id: Iad236bfa9da3e8ce514df8660da39712f1cbebdd

commit_message:
update constraint for ldappool to new release 2.3.1

with Python 3.

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/636718/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 21m 44s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-02-25 16:52:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It feel weird to remove some of this, notably the nova-cells manpage and nova-related filters, and pretend the entire feature doesn't exist. I do agree with removing the more architectural stuff, but is there any reason we couldn't keep those reference'y section with a big-ass warning that they're effectively useless, similar to what we do with the REST API stuff."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-02-25 22:53:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I do agree with removing the more architectural stuff, but is there any reason we couldn't keep those reference'y section with a big-ass warning that they're effectively useless, similar to what we do with the REST API stuff.

It's more about continuing to whittle away at dropping this from user-facing stuff to avoid confusion and just slowly creep toward dropping it. In the ML linked from the commit message, Belmiro already said they are off cells v1 and don't need the service code so we're OK to drop it (except currently in-tree nova-network won't start without cells v1 being enabled, so we have to technically drop nova-network first, and CERN is still using nova-network in parts of their deployment). I also think of this like how we dropped the cells v1 job to the experimental queue so that it's just more and more of a thing that we don't have to see/deal with on a daily basis. People can get at the cells v1 docs on stable branch docs if they want. But yes this is part of an attempt to effectively act like the feature doesn't exist because we don't want people knowing about it or using it."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-02-26 09:08:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

> > I do agree with removing the more architectural stuff, but is
 > there any reason we couldn't keep those reference'y section with a
 > big-ass warning that they're effectively useless, similar to what
 > we do with the REST API stuff.
 > 
 > It's more about continuing to whittle away at dropping this from
 > user-facing stuff to avoid confusion and just slowly creep toward
 > dropping it. In the ML linked from the commit message, Belmiro
 > already said they are off cells v1 and don't need the service code
 > so we're OK to drop it (except currently in-tree nova-network won't
 > start without cells v1 being enabled, so we have to technically
 > drop nova-network first, and CERN is still using nova-network in
 > parts of their deployment). I also think of this like how we
 > dropped the cells v1 job to the experimental queue so that it's
 > just more and more of a thing that we don't have to see/deal with
 > on a daily basis. People can get at the cells v1 docs on stable
 > branch docs if they want. But yes this is part of an attempt to
 > effectively act like the feature doesn't exist because we don't
 > want people knowing about it or using it.

OK, I trust you've thought about this far more than I have, so let's do this."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-07 23:24:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-13 19:01:15.000000000', 'message': "Remove cells v1 (for the most part) from the docs

As discussed in the mailing list [1] since cells v1
has been deprecated since Pike and the biggest user
of it (CERN as far as we know) moved to cells v2
in Queens, we can start rolling back the cells v1
specific documentation to avoid confusing people
new to nova about what cells is and making them
understand there was an optional v1.

There are still a few mentions of cells v1 left in
here for things like adding a new cell which need
to be re-written and for that I've left a todo.

Users can still get at cells v1 specific docs from
published stable branches and/or rebuilding the
docs from before this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002569.html

Change-Id: Idaa04a88b6883254cad9a8c6665e1c63a67e88d3
"}]
commit_message:
Remove cells v1 (for the most part) from the docs

As discussed in the mailing list [1] since cells v1
has been deprecated since Pike and the biggest user
of it (CERN as far as we know) moved to cells v2
in Queens, we can start rolling back the cells v1
specific documentation to avoid confusing people
new to nova about what cells is and making them
understand there was an optional v1.

There are still a few mentions of cells v1 left in
here for things like adding a new cell which need
to be re-written and for that I've left a todo.

Users can still get at cells v1 specific docs from
published stable branches and/or rebuilding the
docs from before this change.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/002569.html

Change-Id: Idaa04a88b6883254cad9a8c6665e1c63a67e88d3

[{'created': '2018-11-07 09:20:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add free for claimed, allocated devices

Currently freeing PCI resources for instance frees
both claimed and allocated resources.
Extend the API and remove this constraint.

The change is required to enable SR-IOV live migration.

Change-Id: Id961f0fc219f32a2cf0282859f228e87cb36ffeb
Partial-Implements: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

commit_message:
Separate methods to free claimed and allocated devs

The existing PCI manager exposes a single method to free PCI resources
free_instance(), which frees both claimed and allocated PCI resources
for an instance.

This change proposes to extend the PCI manager API with two methods:
  1. free_instance_claims() : free PCI resources claims for instance.
  2. free_instance_allocations() : free PCI resources allocations for
     instance.

This change refactors free_instance() to use (1) and (2) from above.

This change is required to enable SR-IOV live migration as it is
required to free instance PCI allocations on the source node
in case of a successful migration and free instance PCI claims
on the destination node in case of an unsuccessful migration.

Change-Id: Id961f0fc219f32a2cf0282859f228e87cb36ffeb
Partial-Implements: blueprint libvirt-neutron-sriov-livemigration

Xenial kernels do not include the fix for local VXLAN tunnels
(bug/1684897), we still have to use a locally compiled version.

On Xenial nodes, the Queens UCA repository has openvswitch 2.9.0
On Bionic nodes, we have 2.9.2

So use the latest 2.9 release for fullstack testing

Change-Id: Ifb61daa1f14969a1d09379599081e96053488f9f
Closes-Bug: #1818632
'}]
commit_message:
[Fullstack] Use newer openvswitch

Current version used is old and does not work on Bionic nodes. But as
Xenial kernels do not include the fix for local VXLAN tunnels
(bug/1684897), we still have to use a locally compiled version.

On Xenial nodes, the Queens UCA repository has openvswitch 2.9.0
On Bionic nodes, we have 2.9.2

So use the latest 2.9 release for fullstack testing

Change-Id: Ifb61daa1f14969a1d09379599081e96053488f9f
Closes-Bug: #1818632

commit_message:
only fail pypi permission validation if the project exists

If the project does not exist, it will be created correctly by the
release job. If it does exist, we cannot add a user to it so that has
to be done correctly.

Change-Id: I78173d855c11c8f9e8d75548b0882a4e7d27765f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

What can I say, this changes the py2 behavior: the errors that were silent before will become exceptions now. But let's try it out."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-04 18:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> What can I say, this changes the py2 behavior

Does it? If you back out the changes under swift/, the new unit test still passes on py2...

> the errors that were silent before will become exceptions now

Oh, I see what you mean. But the strings on py2 (should) always be bytes already.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-03-07 06:02:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Testing with py2 and py3. The test fails if I roll back the changes. So looks good.

More of these crazy string messiness. Once all said and done a py3 developer guide for devs with all these gotchas (all the wsgi string helper methods) would be handy once we are full python3 supported.
Because wow, talk about wsgi strings are then never ending troubles. I so wish we could refactor them away into our requests so only every have to worry about them in one place. but I know that's not easily done."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-03-07 17:46:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
py3: fix copying unicode names

Turns out, unquote()ing WSGI strings is a great way to mangle them.

Change-Id: I42a08d84aa22a1a7ee7ccab97aaec55d845264f9

commit_message:
Move ResourceClass and ResourceClassList to own module

This is a precursor to getting rid of the ResourceClassList
class in favor of operating on native python lists.

With the move, also create new unit and functional test files
for the new module, and move resource class syncing into the new
module.

The ensure_resource_classes_sync is renamed to ensure_sync since
its membership in the resource_class module gives sufficient
namespacing.

Change-Id: I95c383e22f11fce2eb68ef29106fe045315644b6

subject: Add database backup option.
messages:
[{'account_id': 28875, 'date': '2019-02-12 23:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-02-13 00:00:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Add database backup option.

  * a backup script to mariadb and postgresql
  * a restore script to mariadb and postgressql
  * change to the configMap template to add the script

Change-Id: I93580697630870755505fd9896600eb04f605806

commit_message:
Mention compute API 2.50 in openstack quota show --class

There is a bug in the compute API until microversion 2.50
where the server-groups and server-group-members class
quota fields aren't returned. This just mentions that
microversion in the command help text.

Change-Id: I029a614a922d642c578618c478c4d0a29a394fc2
Task: 21490
Story: 2002194

commit_message:
Add workflow for plan deployment status

Add a new workflow used for checking the plan deployment status. With
the move to config-download, the Heat API is no longer the source of
truth for deployment status.

This patch makes use of the top level deployment_status added in
Ib854689a3e606f18db7354427918fa8043ac28e0 to expose the deployment
status via a workflow.

Implements: blueprint config-download-default

Change-Id: Ia8e3ecadfb97c0827c396cd418c32d3daa2e299b
(cherry picked from commit 04afa0c8a5555086048c63f1521b5c72f17a6200)

commit_message:
Small corrections in image_uploader

This patch addresses the small nits and comments listed in
https://review.openstack.org/639037

It also addresses some scoping issues detected afterward.

Finally, it corrects some logic issues - the no_verify_registries
should not influence on the URL building, since it affects an
option inside the requests.Session option.

Change-Id: I1eba8b982dab777e44da2b75666ea6aa8fa38c5e
